title: Quarkus for embedded systems

labels.name: area/quarkiverse
labels.description: This issue/PR is part of the Quarkiverse organization

body:
### Description

Hi,
I'm not sure what is interesting because targed for Quarkus is cloud native but let's discuss because this feature already implemented by me year ago for JVM/Native modes and need to add only Quarkus integration.
 
**Disclaimer:**
I will deliberately simplify the description of feature to better undersanding of community because embedded systems it's separated world.

**Intro:**
at this moment all embedded systems devided by 2 big groups - simple devices (like teapot) with small chipsets(like STM32*) and something like RTOS on board and more poverfull devices with Linux(OpenWRT, Armbian, Android, etc). In second group I can include your home router/repeater, mobile phone, drone and a lot of other devices).
To better undersanding of these devices - good example is Raspberry Pi.
"Old school" guys can understand what hardware in RPI4 more powerfull what we have in enterprise servers 10-15 years ago :) (it's if you want to ask question about java and performance).

Technically Oracle tried to intoduce embedded in J2ME and in https://openjdk.java.net/projects/dio/ but both projects was hardcoded to specific hardware and looks like dead at this moment.

**What will be implemented:**
Access to [SPI bus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_Peripheral_Interface)
Access to [I2C bus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I%C2%B2C)
Access to [Serial(USB/COM/etc)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_communication)
in JVM/native without any dependency to vendor hardware. Library will re-use linux drivers for HW.

Limitation:
Only Linux platforms[tested in Raspberrian/Armbian/Ubuntu in Broadcom/Allwinner chipset at this moment].

Is it interesting?
I propose to implement this feature in quarkiverse project
